memberdef.argsstring: (__dppl_keep const DPPLSyclQueueRef QRef1, __dppl_keep const DPPLSyclQueueRef QRef2)
memberdef.name: DPPLQueue_AreEq

briefdescription.para: Checks if two DPPLSyclQueueRef objects point to the same sycl::queue.

parameterdescription.para: First opaque pointer to the sycl queue.
Second opaque pointer to the sycl queue.

simplesect.para: True if the underlying sycl::queue are same, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Delete the pointer after casting it to sycl::queue.

detaileddescription.para:
QRef
A DPPLSyclQueueRef pointer that gets deleted.
Delete the passed in pointer after verifying it points to a sycl::queue.

briefdescription.para: Returns the Sycl backend for the provided sycl::queue.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl queue.

simplesect.para: A enum DPPLSyclBackendType corresponding to the backed for the queue.

briefdescription.para: Returns the Sycl context for the queue.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl queue.

simplesect.para: A DPPLSyclContextRef pointer to the sycl context for the queue.

briefdescription.para: returns the Sycl device for the queue.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl queue.

simplesect.para: A DPPLSyclDeviceRef pointer to the sycl device for the queue.

memberdef.argsstring: (__dppl_keep const DPPLSyclQueueRef QRef, void *Dest, const void *Src, size_t Count)
memberdef.name: DPPLQueue_Memcpy

briefdescription.para: C-API wrapper for sycl::queue::memcpy, the function waits on an event till the memcpy operation completes.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl queue.
An USM pointer to the destination memory.
An USM pointer to the source memory.
A number of bytes to copy.

memberdef.argsstring: (__dppl_keep const DPPLSyclKernelRef KRef, __dppl_keep const DPPLSyclQueueRef QRef, __dppl_keep void **Args, __dppl_keep const DPPLKernelArgType *ArgTypes, size_t NArgs, __dppl_keep const size_t gRange[3], __dppl_keep const size_t lRange[3], size_t NDims, __dppl_keep const DPPLSyclEventRef *DepEvents, size_t NDepEvents)
memberdef.name: DPPLQueue_SubmitNDRange

briefdescription.para: Submits the kernel to the specified queue with the provided nd_range argument.

detaileddescription.para: A wrapper over sycl::queue.submit(). The function takes an interoperability kernel, the kernel arguments, and a Sycl queue as input. The kernel is submitted as parallel_for(nd_range<NRange>, *unwrap(KRef)).

xrefdescription.para: sycl::buffer arguments are not supported yet.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque pointer to an OpenCL interoperability kernel wrapped inside a sycl::kernel.
Opaque pointer to the sycl::queue where the kernel will be enqueued.
An array of void* pointers that represent the kernel arguments for the kernel.
An array of DPPLKernelArgType enum values that represent the type of each kernel argument.
Size of Args.
Defines the overall dimension of the dispatch for the kernel. The array can have up to three dimensions.
Defines the iteration domain of a single work-group in a parallel dispatch. The array can have up to three dimensions.
The number of dimensions for both local and global ranges.
List of dependent DPPLSyclEventRef objects (events) for the kernel. We call sycl::handler.depends_on for each of the provided events.
Size of the DepEvents list.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl::event returned by the sycl::queue.submit() function.

memberdef.argsstring: (__dppl_keep const DPPLSyclKernelRef KRef, __dppl_keep const DPPLSyclQueueRef QRef, __dppl_keep void **Args, __dppl_keep const DPPLKernelArgType *ArgTypes, size_t NArgs, __dppl_keep const size_t Range[3], size_t NRange, __dppl_keep const DPPLSyclEventRef *DepEvents, size_t NDepEvents)
memberdef.name: DPPLQueue_SubmitRange

briefdescription.para: Submits the kernel to the specified queue with the provided range argument.

detaileddescription.para: A wrapper over sycl::queue.submit(). The function takes an interoperability kernel, the kernel arguments, and a Sycl queue as input. The kernel is submitted as parallel_for(range<NRange>, *unwrap(KRef)).

xrefdescription.para: sycl::buffer arguments are not supported yet.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque pointer to an OpenCL interoperability kernel wrapped inside a sycl::kernel.
Opaque pointer to the sycl::queue where the kernel will be enqueued.
An array of void* pointers that represent the kernel arguments for the kernel.
An array of DPPLKernelArgType enum values that represent the type of each kernel argument.
Size of Args and ArgTypes.
Defines the overall dimension of the dispatch for the kernel. The array can have up to three dimensions.
Size of the gRange array.
List of dependent DPPLSyclEventRef objects (events) for the kernel. We call sycl::handler.depends_on for each of the provided events.
Size of the DepEvents list.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer to the sycl::event returned by the sycl::queue.submit() function.

briefdescription.para: Calls the sycl::queue.submit function to do a blocking wait on all enqueued tasks in the queue.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque pointer to a sycl::queue.

detaileddescription.para: This header declares a C interface to sycl::queue member functions. Note that sycl::queue constructors are not exposed in this interface. Instead, users should use the functions in dppl_sycl_queue_manager.h.
